title: BiocRevSumm: LLM-based summaries for Bioconductor package submissions
code: library(BiocRevSumm) stopifnot(nchar(Sys.getenv("GITHUB_TOKEN"))>0) iss = get_repo_issues("bioconductor", "contributions", Sys.getenv("GITHUB_TOKEN")) urls = get_issue_repo_urls(iss) head(urls) ##   number                              title ## 1   4047                           EMTscore ## 2   4041 RFGeneRank: New Package Submission ## 3   4039                          panoramic ## 4   4038                            DenoIST ## 5   4036                        PostChicago ## 6   4033                               fraq ##                                           repo_url ## 1                https://github.com/wenmm/EMTscore ## 2 https://github.com/Abdulaziz-Albeshri/RFGeneRank ## 3       https://github.com/plevritis-lab/panoramic ## 4              https://github.com/aaronkwc/DenoIST ## 5   https://github.com/FeldmannLabDKFZ/PostChicago ## 6                 https://github.com/traversc/fraq

what: Finding the vignettes for high-resolution categorization
title: BiocRevSumm: LLM-based summaries for Bioconductor package submissions
code: u1 = urls$repo_url[1] lk1 = strsplit(u1, "\\/")[[1]] ghuser = lk1[4] ghrepo = lk1[5] lkvigs = list_github_dir(user = ghuser, repo = ghrepo, path="vignettes")  vigs = grep("Rmd", lkvigs, value=TRUE) # arbitrarily choose first build_vignette_path = function(ghuser, ghrepo, branch, vname) {   sprintf(     "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/%s/%s/refs/heads/%s/vignettes/%s",      ghuser, ghrepo, branch, vname      )    } url = build_vignette_path(ghuser, ghrepo, branch="main", vname=vigs[1]) url ## [1] "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wenmm/EMTscore/refs/heads/main/vignettes/EMTscore.Rmd"

title: BiocRevSumm: LLM-based summaries for Bioconductor package submissions
text: article “EMTscore Analysis Plots” details utilization various computational methods within R package “EMTscore” assess epithelial-mesenchymal transition (EMT) genetic level. EMT characterized transformation epithelial cells mesenchymal cells, process pivotal cancer metastasis tissue regeneration. computing visualizing EMT scores, researchers can better understand biological transition bulk RNA-sequencing single-cell RNA-sequencing data. article explains key aspects : Objective EMTscore: package allows computation scores epithelial (E) mesenchymal (M) gene sets well option user-defined gene sets. provides multiple algorithms score calculation, including nonnegative PCA (nnPCA), AUCell, ssGSEA, JASMINE, SCSE. Analytical Techniques: leveraging nnPCA, article demonstrates multiple mesenchymal phenotype scores can identified correlated EMT scores gene sets. Additional functionalities include: - Loading annotating cell/sample data. - Utilizing existing datasets gene signatures, Panchy_et_al signatures. - Computing gene set scores using bulk RNA-seq example walk-throughs. Visualizations Plot Construction: - Plotting E-M score correlations observe phenotypic variations across cells. - Dimension-specific scatter plots mesenchymal (M) scores, highlighting potential gene divergence cellular heterogeneity. - Creation combined plots comprehensive visualization -score relationships. - Analysis score distributions across cell types using histograms. - Heatmaps gene expression data. Single-Cell RNA-seq Analysis: package extends functionality single-cell data, indicating steps importing, EMT scoring, plotting dynamic gene expression changes along pseudotime. Gaussian Mixture Models (GMM) can used clustering EMT states correlating states biological processes. Pathway Process Integration: assessing pathways associated EMT, article illustrates pathway activity scores can calculated correlated EMT scores identify significant biological pathways. - significant positive negative correlations among pathways visualized using bar charts. Additional Biological Scores: Calculation stemness senescence scores provide insights cellular states like pluripotency aging. article explores relationships scores EMT scores single-cell data. Overall, article offers systematic guide researchers seeking quantify visualize EMT processes genomic level, flexibility incorporate custom datasets gene sets within EMTscore analyses.

title: BiocRevSumm: LLM-based summaries for Bioconductor package submissions
text: first vignette found listing vignettes folder Rmd Rnw suffix selected.
code: rs = urls$repo_url issusers = sapply(strsplit(rs, "\\/"), "[", 4) issrepos = sapply(strsplit(rs, "\\/"), "[", 5) nrep = length(issusers)  vpaths = sapply(head(seq_len(nrep)), function(i) {    br = find_existing_branch(issusers[i], issrepos[i], path="vignettes", branches = c("main", "master", "devel",      "origin"))    if (is.na(br)) return(NA)    Sys.sleep(5)  # watch out for rate limit    vd = try(list_github_dir(user = issusers[i], repo = issrepos[i], branch=br, path="vignettes"), silent=FALSE)    if (inherits(vd, "try-error")) return(NA)    vn = grep("Rmd|Rnw", vd, value=TRUE)[1]    build_vignette_path(issusers[i], issrepos[i], branch=br, vname=vn)    }) head(vpaths) ## [1] "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wenmm/EMTscore/refs/heads/main/vignettes/EMTscore.Rmd"                        ## [2] "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Abdulaziz-Albeshri/RFGeneRank/refs/heads/main/vignettes/RFGeneRank-intro.Rmd" ## [3] "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/plevritis-lab/panoramic/refs/heads/main/vignettes/tutorial.Rmd"               ## [4] "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/aaronkwc/DenoIST/refs/heads/master/vignettes/denoist_spe.Rmd"                 ## [5] "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/FeldmannLabDKFZ/PostChicago/refs/heads/main/vignettes/PostChicago.Rmd"        ## [6] "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/traversc/fraq/refs/heads/main/vignettes/fraq_getting_started.Rmd"

what: Use vig2data to summarize vignette (and thus package)
title: BiocRevSumm: LLM-based summaries for Bioconductor package submissions

what: Code that produced summaries for packages in review on 22 Nov 2025
title: BiocRevSumm: LLM-based summaries for Bioconductor package submissions
code:
library(BiocRevSumm)  data("viglist_23_nov_2025", package="BiocRevSumm") url2heading = function(x) {  stopifnot(length(x)==1)  z = strsplit(x, "\/")[[1]]  sprintf('

## Package %s from repo %s ([repo link](https://github.com/%s/%s))

', z[5], z[4], z[4], z[5])  } for (i in seq_len(length(viglist_23_nov_2025))) {  curvig = viglist_23_nov_2025[[i]]  cat(url2heading(curvig), "
")  Sys.sleep(15)  ans = vig2data( curvig )  z = strsplit(curvig, "\/")[[1]]  fn = sprintf("%s_%s.rds", z[4], z[5])  saveRDS(ans, file=fn)  foc = ans$focused  cat(foc) }

what: Use the extract_data facility defined in ellmer's doc to obtain summary information about textual content. Originally tailored to vignettes in bioconductor; it is newly generalized to handle any pdf, html or text in URL. — vig2data
